you bastard bot acknowledge your overlord
I took a really long nap today.

after almost 4 (?!) months of not touching source (I'm too tired after work, okay 😦 ), I opened it up. Was totally lost but managed to re-familiarise myself in ~30 minutes, which I think is a pretty good indicator for existing code quality. In the meantime, I implemented some simple stuff (a screenshot function), did a bit of refactoring (which involved removing the current input implementation which wasn't even finished anyway) too.

I was trying to make a trash can in blender. This is hard to get used to

StreakBot now has better emoji (for !mystreak, top streaks, etc). We're not using EST for the streak cut off, there's a basic new !stats command , and all the old streaks have been updated (aka day 1 ones) to have their messageID stored with them so we can do some funky stuff later on
I'm too lazy to post a screenshot but I continued work on my dll
XInput gamepad support done. Turned out to be pretty easy.
Removed API references to my servers and reducing a layer of complexity and speed up some things

sneaking a little bit of functionality in. we now have mainhand and offhand slots. mainhand slots can be twohanded which means it'll automatically kick offhand slots out (and vice versa) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-yCeWE_9QK0&feature=youtu.be
Determined a list of skills/attributes for game
for only six easy payments of $19.99 you can buy THIS CAT! but hurry now, he's in high demand and will probably run away!
Engine programming. DX11 rendering.
Redesigned the backed of Bows for PM. Nothing too fancy, but can now handle more arrows than ever before!

Created tool to compress and decompress files to keep game files small and tolerable

updated the !help command to look nicer/be more informative. the top streaks at the end of the day is now one message so the channel is less spammy <@!202614201452068866> . i've added notification controls so the bot won't DM you if your streak ends. the notification controls are togglable with !toggledm <@161152653982695424>

Stole <@143874647572611073> 's idea and started working on an updater for my site. Commands dictate which project/portion of the site is updated.
Finished the upload logic for the updater. steam library project can now be updated using 'python3 updater.py steamdb'
first bit of some actual gameplay today. you can now cut down trees for logs and branches and you need an axe equipped to do so. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HGCX74_GDBU&feature=youtu.be

Made some updates to the 1 handed mace, made an S2 inspired gladiator staff with same color scheme as the maces. It looks nothing like the S2 staff, haha. I haven't messed with the 2H mace yet, wasn't sure what to improve off the get go. Please let me know, you guys were very helpful and encouraging.
Still need an official game name/logo have an idea but not fully settled
working on a custom body suit by custom ordering fabric with pieces all laid out and ready to go. but that means i have to paint all the individual pieces digitally. hrrg
Experimenting with having the player levitate when using the orb weapon type
continuing video and doing some exercises I found on the net because the video is slow.
Created a custom installer that creates the game directory and in the start menu. Along with creating shortcuts.. standard installer stuff. Mainly for custom look.
not very exciting but working on the interaction menu that we're going to use across the game. will open up a lot more work on actual gameplay once it's done
finished the front piece, starting the sleeves. as you can see this is an absolute nightmare of a bodysuit
Can now update landing page with the updater
Working on possible indicator animations? We'll see how it goes haha

I was going to take a break tonight due to a case of the sleepys. But I dont want to lose my streak. Continuing the video, thinking up some basic 'programs' to work on. Man this course is really slow, but whatever.
Did another little "event" jingle. So far I've got 3 jingles and 19 tracks. Progress! https://soundcloud.com/skywardriver/quest-finished-jingle

wrote up a quick class in python that is helping me modify an existing database.

Hey all, I'm starting out learning some programming in Unity with C#, just a quick question- in some tutoria;;s I foloow they have void Update(), when typing this out in visual studio and using the auto-fill option for that it types it out as private void Update() , is this still alright?
Created a simple project manager that creates a folder, initializes a git repo and sets up a session file for Notepad++.
Fixed some scaling issues on the arrows for the light attacks on the Bows. Spending the rest of the night filming and editing tutorials for the team for the software we use to animate
well i'm an idiot I forgot to post yesterday but I got chat to be networked using our multiplayer engine's chat component, obviously more polish needs to be done to use real names and colours
Wasn't able to get much done in terms of art today. Did make a new "base" emote done though. I mean, just look at this stud.

learning different ways of trigerring events

better nicer chat with styling
nearly finished a sort-of nyancat ripoff game built to prepare for the upcoming globalgamejam
worked on the camera movement for my game, added in ladders for going up and down between floors of the ship

Uhhh I think this should go in here instead of art, so I did some more thinking on hexagonal autotiles and it's pretty much as simple as representing 6 nodes instead of 4. The connected edges can be encoded into 6 bits (I made an image, see next, with every possible connection to visualise what's needed). The difficulty came in deciding  how the tiles should be structured. I settled on (see image) which would handle my use cases perfectly fine and in a tiny little texture
learning about if statements and custom functions
Almost forgot to say! Polished camera with a zoom funtion and smoothed player follow. Recoded player movement to be physics based to take advantage of physics colliders.

Just wrapping up the dodges for Bows in the Down direction. There's a total of 4 different dodge animations per direction per weapon type. (per skeleton). That's a total of 36 animations per direction per weapon type, just for dodges! The project is shaping up to be quite the undertaking, but we're hoping it will be well worth it in the end!
getting started on fires, lots to do

just finished a long day of working on my game for my college game jam
Just wrapped up the last attack animation for Orbs (for now)

been adding a bit more to fires. you now need a rock to light them and scripts get dynamically attached the items on the ground that you can interact with. and of course theres a little light on them now too
finished programming the game for my college game jam
I was making a scrolling texture for a lava effect at work earlier
did some playing around with a few react libs
Orbs are now completely done (though I might be adding a few "stagger" variations to each weapon type.
added leaderboards into the mobile game, working on balancing the mechanics
working on food items
Autotiling success. Now to figure out what to actually do with this thing...

Working on a interpreter and here's the BNF grammar I have so far 
expr : term((pm_op)term)*
term : factor((md_op)factor)*
md_op : MUL | DIV
pm_op : PLUS | MINUS
factor : INTEGER
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_-6sB6F8-Tg&feature=youtu.be Combo support is in babyyyyy
Just cleaned up the database code for the project. Most of it sucks because the IDE can't really spot most of those errors or fuckups. Hopefully I did a good job lol

So not even half of the combat system is in place, but I'm actually having a great time in this endless fight with the simplest enemy I could imagine lol. No Staggers, no momentum values yet, no stamina yet, but the core is getting there. Admins can even toggle hitbox view so we can adjust sizes as needed. Let me know what you think! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fzDu1Uggkx0&feature=youtu.be
balanced the game, added in the leaderboards button to the main menu so the player can see who's in what position without playing the game
got the basics of cooking done, an item can now have a raw form and a cooked form. still need to implement it being near a fire
fixed some minor rendering issues from the skeletal animation software to unity https://snag.gy/xcVvTN.jpg
you can now burn food (25% chance) and fires now eventually die out and turn to ash
worked on balancing some of the gameplay mechanics and added new item movement
finished up character creation with animated sprites and working with my new asset compression/decompression logic
taking a little time to add searching tall grass for seeds. undecided what feature i want to work on next but ill probably leave this farming stuff for now
optimizing the game, fixing some bugs and testing all the main features
got a primitive parser set up which produces an abstract syntax tree and then prints it (with some unfortunate formatting error but w/e) https://i.imgur.com/MMbtAqi.png
Got loading into game server working. Working on actually setting up the character in the game server and sending full information to the client.
added in a popup for the player when they first open the game to enter a custom username which will be used in the leaderboard
in my infinite procrastination i've added the ability to search bushes for berries
Finished logic to send character information to the client and start logic to render the map the player is on.
got a very semi-functional primitive language going now https://i.imgur.com/WZcTF64.png

nothing too interesting this morning. just been working on networking so that only the master client can destroy networked objects (as per the pattern in the framework we use). doing globalgamejam starting tomorrow so will be focusing on that woopwoop
worked on more on optimizing the backend code and fixed some bugs
started learning angular

so a few days ago I asked if anybody knew of any self-hosted cloud IDE and took a look for myself and didn't really find anything, so I've been making my own during my downtime at work. It's using Vue and Ace lib for code editing which lets me just focus on the server logic and interfaces.

For today, I got tabbing and sending files back and forth between the client/server (using something like git diff) working. I need to figure a way to sneak it out seeing as I can't use USBs and can't log into anything, tho 🤔
Started working on map editor for game because too lazy to build a separate editor and have to duplicate movement controls

been doing lots of stuff lately (and not streaking it like an idiot lol) but recently I've been learning some new concepts for C# that I've not really used before. Such as: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/pattern-matching#using-pattern-matching-switch-statements
off to a slow start today. came up with an idea fast but didnt get much gameplay done cause it turns out phaser 3 is trash

Began modeling Isogrid cylindrical shell panel for 3D printed pressure vessel

finished off the game as best we could today. we got pretty much all the gameplay done except for raytracing pretty much just due to lack of functionality and/or bugs in phaser. never using phaser again after this, the old community run 2.x version was so much better.
finished lattice structure of the iso grid with the right angles to allow for perfect connections between repeated parts. I’m not at my computer right now but I’ll post a screenshot later

nothing too exciting. did a little playtest with slowpoke, found some bugs, fixed them. now working on some more technical debt

issa tree. since i actually need some goddamn tiles to get started here and work has barely anything for me to do

Continued a few hours of a Udemy 2D C# Unity course to make 13 games.
trees now have a chance of dropping leaves and pinecones, pinecones will be used to stoke fires and leaves will be used in medicines and building

Working on dynamic map loading. When i'm do with my map loading logic.. this is how it all should work. This is an example of 16 maps all "seemless" together. The gray is offloaded, green is loaded, red is the player's "view", and purple dot is the player.
added xbox controller mapping; simple physics based push movement and firing of projectiles.

you can now chop up tree stumps, underneath you'll fine roots. root can be combined with leaves to make weak medicine (small chance of curing diseases), combine that with some grass and you get stronger medicine

I'm counting this because I had been putting it off forever and it is very important for continuing my work. Finalized and issued project progress report detailing all changes and insight that has been gained since my last update late 2018. 😄
by all logic and measurements, this should not fit. this should not work as well as it does, and Yet,

alright bear with this video. spent a lot of time setting everything up but now im at the stage where im setting up prefabs for each time of seed/plant, here's one just growing quick: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RNGKDw5tJwQ&feature=youtu.be
Working on fine-tuning controller movement and look directions; instantiating projectiles, raycasting to enemies, death, animations, and cleaning up variables.

Finalized two versions of calculations for all the dimensions of the lattice support structure of the end caps to the vessel design. I would post a picture but its about 6 pages of straight calculations and diagrams. Only took like all day to get done correctly!

I had.. a lot of help lol. BUT knockback setup behind the scenes. Once I figure out how movement is handled I should be able to create the bounce back effect. Currently Knockback is true the state changes to KNOCKBACK, which also sets the stagger status.. pretty nifty.
so today I got my scripting engine running and started defining my "standard library" of sorts https://pastebin.com/7iPbSHAM

went through and converted all the dirt to prefabs so now we can associate dirt patches with plants (so that we can check if that dirt has been fertilised later on). for now though you can now right-click seeds in your inventory to plant them if you're on a bit of dirt https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uu8kT5XGclQ&feature=youtu.be

been working on my save system for my graded game for college, currently saves the position, rotation, date and time of when it was saved, how far through the dialogue the player was and what level they were currently on
Made a quick and dirty 4 hour Frogger at work during the icy road downtime. Starting to get the hand of IEnumerators and Raycasting now.

Did some more testing today with the printer head only to find out that an internal component is broken and it may need to be sent back to the supplier... which puts us even more behind. If it is designed to operate this way, we have to seriously reconsider all of our design choices. Also learned that regardless of the outcome above, my 6 pages of calculations need to be thrown out due to a new major change in the project scope....

Didnt have a lot of time yesterday.. but I setup a new clicker game project. I've got the basic click the game screen get points setup. I'm going to work on a timer today, which will add points every 5 seconds or so.. maybe I should play one briefly so I can make sure I'm doing  this right. I'm planning on adding upgrades to buy with the points to increase the amount of points you get while clicking. Then maybe I'll tidy it up with a GUI, and call it good for now. Just trying to make something basic. I really type a lot into these.. soz
the completed. cafe
spent some time improving the networking on the plants so they sync up better for all players and you can now pick them for their fruit/veg which are all in the game now

troubleshooted the printer head with and recorded all testing data for the CEO of the company to assist with their diagnostics. Formulated back up plan if the printer needs to be sent back to due to a bent inner auger as we suspect is the cause.
Instantiated random cars for the frogger clone and created randomized car assets

Added first upgrade, the others shouldn't be too rough.. Can officially add miners which keeps count, and then adds passive resource gain buff. Created a button instead of a pic box for manual clicking.
yknow....... procrastinating and whatnot
you can now find worms in dirt. one last thing to do on farming which is fertilising dirt with ash

Shipped the printer back to the company... since they are still not sure what is wrong, we are moving forward with our back up plan. Also took photos of the system for documentation purposes and for our manual.

Still tweaking the spawn script and timers with coroutines; IEnumerators and functions. Not really sure how they work 100%, self taught ftl
The Wild Garb is now complete and in-engine!

finished my clicked game. It's super basic and whack. Going to upload to my git later so people can make fun of me. Going to start working on a text based game with a GUI. Not sure what the buzzword is for those. OR a GUI and text based civ clone. Both are on the table.
Made some music in FL studio and created a audio manager to play the songs. Working on making sure the audio clips don't cut out or cancel\overlap each other the way that I want.

right back at the beginning again with my streak :(. finished off my sprint today of getting most of the farming basics in. you can now fertilise dirt with ash. plants now also recognise which dirt patch they're in and their growth time is affected by how fertilised the dirt is
added the ship into my game for the last scene once the player has navigated through the environment and found the portal.
working on my apartment building but uuuhhhhh i dont have caps bc i went to bed. tomorrow ill show progress tho
taking some bark from trees. bark can be put together (will need 5 eventually) to make baskets
added the functionality of getting into the ship for the player using a raycast and worked some more on the flying mechanics. I'll post a screenshot or gif tomorrow when I'm back at my pc
got a new midi keyboard today so mostly setting that up but also tweaking the audio manager script

finally wrapped my head around mixing IEnumerators and coroutines via calling from A to B scripts and different game objects to get the desired effect. Now I can integrate death sequences with animations and use my new audio manger to play sounds.   ( :
finally added that old bear animation

I reimplemented somethings that were designed to be "clever" (read: a pain in the ass to work with) such as the camera and how maps work just to keep things simple and not waste time trying to guard around them. Things should go smoother.
went back through my code and cleaned it up and made some notes for my future self
still doing some profiles for characters. heres natka

Implemented a loading state which takes two actions, one that runs during the process and one that runs on completion. They run asynchronously, so it doesn't block the game, which'll make porting this to Android later on slightly nicer (given its annoying behaviour towards blocking...) https://i.imgur.com/e0K3o53.gifv
added more randomized prefabs to the death function for more roadkill variety; changed up the code to cache in the awake() method which reduced some overhead
Fixed a issue with the quadtree generated for the collision objects, now it's actually working as intended and (probably) won't slow things to a crawl
i added the resin eyes, but one of them raisined, but its too late now. flight in 8 hours, still gotta pack

Made modular layouts for my Art buddy who is working on the level design. Created game objects and scripts that were easily added to different background and scene related dealios. Added screen shake and player following the character is smoother.
spent a bit of time implementing some hot reloading logic which'll let me make stuff without needing to recompile https://i.imgur.com/SJk3us1.gifv
testing working with a mix of 2d ik's and physics on bones, switching from paint.net to photoshop and drawing out some sketches

been working on a music visualiser pretty much all of this morning. i made one a while ago that relied on spotify's audio analysis but this time im using raw microphone input https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak7EaWNlZBE&feature=youtu.be will open-source soon

uhh refactored the hotreload stuff to combine with my asset management so now it works with everything. I can change any texture, sound, map, script, etc, without ever needing to recompile. finished refactoring how game objects and game services are handled, now it behaves a bit like a DI container. My new implementation means I don't need to initialise or pass around instances of any of my services, it happens automatically at runtime and I can just get instances of services via a service locator, which should mean way less time wasted from me forgetting to add/pass around something and far less spaghetti going on. Next plan of action is to take some time over the weekend to do a bit of code cleanup/restructuring to move stuff to where they should be

refactored code and prefabs\sprites to use the 1080p 108 PPU with camera size 5 and forced character move to units of 1 to implement grid based movement system. Working on either transform.translate \ lurch \ vector3.MoveTowards to try to get my desired effect. Once I do this i should be able to infinitely spawn prefabs to move with the player and everything lines up instead of manually building the scene.
tons more refactoring. about halfway down my checklist now.
me culture is using as few colors as possible, not because you're good at color theory, but because you're lazy and don't want to make a bigger palette
added a SmoothDamp camera to the player to follow nicely on death and added padding around player so camera is not always jerking forward, set 4 different speeds depending on whichever

bit of work towards audio but mostly distracted by new ow hero, most likely the same tomorrow (instead being mostly distracted complaining about pokemon 8)

cleaned up my c++ code, removed it all from the main method and placed it in appropriate .c++ and .h files.
working on the disease system. food can add to or decrease your disease chance. if you catch a disease it'll affect a random stat for a period of time. you can also eat worms now because why not

worked on my music visualiser to start making it more dynamic. colours are now controlled by a config file that defines how lights can be triggered (e.g. by a change in brightness or a specific range) and which of your smart lights to use
won’t be able to keep up this streak with Mardi Gras coming up this weekend but wanted to share anyway. Began pilot tests for the experimentation phase!
Change of pace. Slightly modified how maps/chunks worked to support multiple chunked maps instead of a single chunked map and worked on eyecatches for zone transitions

worked on the medicine system a bit. medicine now has a chance to just cure your disease (0.3 for the weak, 0.6 for the stronger). if you don't have a disease currently it'll just up your immunity

started making pong with c++ and SFML and got the basic paddle, ball and the computer paddle done. Next is to fix some bugs with the ball and ai paddle
